intro: Hieracium cunctans, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and serrated. Its yellow flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium cunctans is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread through rhizomes and seeds.
